abstract.t: This document specifies the 'u' extension to BCP 47 which provides for subtags to specify more particular behavior or refinements that are language and/or locale based according to work done by the Unicode Consortium.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: BCP 47 explicitly provides for the ability to define single-letter extension subtags to provide for "the generation of identifiers that contain a language component and are compatible with applications that understand language tags". This extension provides such an extension, using the letter 'u', to specify Unicode language/locale identifiers. See RFC 4646.

section.title: Requirements Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: BCP47 Required Information
section.t: The maintaining authority for this registry is the Unicode Consortium.

texttable.c: Unicode Technical Standard #35 Unicode Locale Data Markup Language (LDML), http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/

section.t: The specification of extension subtags is provided by "Unicode Technical Standard #35 Unicode Locale Data Markup Language (LDML), Section 3.2 BCP 47 Tag Conversion" is hereafter known as "LDML". LDML and all subtags defined by LDML follow the BCP 47 language tag ABNF and other rules for the formation of tags and subtags as defined in BCP 47. In particular, it specifies that case is not significant and no subtags exceed eight characters in length.

LDML specifies a canonical representation. LDML is available over the Internet and at no cost, and is available via a royalty-free license at http://unicode.org/copyright.html. The LDML is versioned, and each version of LDML is numbered, dated, and stable. Extension subtags, once defined by LDML, are never retracted or change in meaning in any substantial way. The specification will include in a separate section the registration form reproduced in this section (below) to be used in registering the extension upon publication as an RFC.

section.title: Summary
section.t: LDML defines the subtags within the 'u' extension as a series of key-value pairs. Each key is of length 2, and each value is of length 3 or more. Each key is followed by zero or one value. Case is not significant. The canonical case is lowercase; the canonical order of the keys is alphabetical.
The exact keys and values available, and their meanings, are defined in LDML, or in referenced data tables.

section.title: Acknowledgements

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document will indirectly result in actions by IANA, according to Section 3.7. Extensions and the Extensions Registry of "Tags for Identifying Languages" in BCP 47.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The security considerations for this extension are the same as those for RFC 4646 (or its successors). See Section 6. Security Considerations of RFC 4646.
